name: Anthony Ling

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Things have been perfectly fabulous since you exterminated that filthy vermin!{self important snob congratulating the player}

topics.topic_text: Do you know anything about the basement?
topics.response_text: I hear there're some tunnels underground for use in emergencies. Ask Gustavo, he's in charge of all those kinds of things.

topics.topic_text: What if all your other neighbors agree?
topics.response_text: If my neighbors lose their minds and agree to such a thing, then I hope security shoots them in the head with their zombie friends.{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: Whatever.
topics.response_text: Um-hmm. Would you mind bothering someone else? PLEASE!{self important snob losing patience}

topics.topic_text: This is happening. You're going to have to deal with it, or get forced out.
topics.response_text: Grrr. You'll regret this. I've spent years collecting all this fabulous merchandise. I won't stand for this! Where the hell am I supposed to go?{bigot facing retribution}

topics.topic_text: I don't care. Get your stuff together and get out of here.
topics.response_text: You'll pay for this. Dearly.{bigot promising revenge}

topics.topic_text: I'm sure you'll find something suitable, don't worry.
topics.response_text: The only suitable place is Tenpenny Tower. Everywhere else stinks and caters to low-life scum like you. I'll die out there. I just know it.{defeated bigot trying to make hero feel bad}

topics.topic_text: Good luck.
topics.response_text: Whatever. My death will be on your head.{defeated bigot trying to make hero feel bad}

topics.topic_text: The only good place for a Ghoul is at the end of a rope.
topics.response_text: Wow! You're a brutal thing aren't you... You're right, of course. You should offer to help Gustavo and his troopers in fighting those Ghouls.{shocked but approving of the players brutality}

topics.topic_text: Most Ghouls are in need of a serious makeover. Huh? Am I right?
topics.response_text: Ha ha ha! You bet. But who would dare touch them to give it to them?{laughing at the misfortunes of others}

topics.topic_text: What do you have against Ghouls, anyway?
topics.response_text: That's a silly question. What I have against Ghouls, is that they are Ghouls!{arrogant bigot}

topics.topic_text: What's it like living at Tenpenny Tower?
topics.response_text: Only those deserving to live here can afford it. And let me tell you, those who do, live in style!{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: I've noticed the quality of living is rather high here, isn't it?
topics.response_text: And you can thank me for that. I'm the resident guide to all things fabulous.{gloating}

topics.topic_text: I bet people are dying to live here. You're all lucky you can afford it.
topics.response_text: People ARE dying to get in here. Like those dirty Ghouls... or at least they should be dying. Security has got to get their act together.{annoyed}

topics.topic_text: Blah blah blah!
topics.response_text: You are in definite need of an attitude adjustment. Like those God-awful Ghouls scrabbling at the gate all the time.{annoyed}

topics.topic_text: Are you worried about those Ghouls?
topics.response_text: They were told they can't live here. But those zombies are too stupid to understand.{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: I might be able to solve this problem.
topics.response_text: Hmm. You're certainly welcome to try, aren't you? Talk to Chief Gustavo.{glad someone is taking charge}

topics.topic_text: I'll go tell them there's nothing here worth dying over.
topics.response_text: What are you suggesting by that? I don't think I like your tone!{self important indignation}

topics.topic_text: It's only a matter of time.
topics.response_text: I suppose it is, isn't it?{bored by the conversation}

topics.topic_text: How would you feel about having a few Ghoul neighbors?
topics.response_text: It's my turn, eh? Well, you won't be getting me to go along with your ridiculous plan.{angry}

topics.topic_text: Yeah. Ghouls are disgusting creatures.
topics.response_text: You don't have to tell me that.{(agreeing) self important snob}

topics.topic_text: I've met these Ghouls. They're civilized and pose no threat.
topics.response_text: Why would you hang out with dirty vermin like that? You enjoy sifting through feces?{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: Whatever.
topics.response_text: Don't you have something better to do?{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: In case you haven't noticed, I run a fabulous shop, and live in the most fabulous of places. You can't push people like me around! Ha!{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: Tell me about Allistair Tenpenny.
topics.response_text: A very well dressed gentleman, when he bothers to get dressed. He hardly ever leaves his penthouse suite.

topics.topic_text: You really think you can improve my look?
topics.response_text: With my fashion sense and your bottlecaps, there's no limit to what we can do for your image! I can't wait to get started!{snobby merchant excited to find a new client}

topics.topic_text: You got a problem with the way I dress?
topics.response_text: Fine. Keep wearing that trashy outfit. I don't care. You probably couldn't afford to upgrade your look anyway. Ah, I could have made you fabulous.{snobby merchant after he got rebuked}

topics.topic_text: Whatever.
topics.response_text: Look, if you don't care about yourself, then no one else will. And nothing says "I love me" better than a fabulous new look. Am I right? I'm right.{snobby clothes merchant trying to encourage a slacker}

topics.topic_text: I'd like to do business with you.
topics.response_text: I only carry the finest garments.

conversation.response_text: Ewwww! Labcoats are so last century. I have a better idea, Doc. Why don't you come to New Urban Apparel, and I'll give you a complete make-over!{playfully chiding a customer}
Looks like someone woke up on the wrong side of the bed. I bet I could help you end up on the right side! Haha! Have good day, dear.{flirting}
Ouch! You wound me!{playfully sad (verging on melodrama)}
Time for a snack.{hungry and on his way to get food}
Time to get some beauty rest!{tired and heading off to bed}
Hey! What are you up to old man?{confused and slightly suspicious}

description:
Anthony Ling is a 38 year-old Asian Male.

The proprietor of Tenpenny Tower's finest (and only) clothing store, Anthony Ling carries a selection of pre-War apparel salvaged throughout the years. As a whole, he fits in with the snobbish, privileged residents of the tower. Ling suggests "retail therapy" as a means of solving their problems, telling Margaret Primrose to purchase new clothes rather than mope. Perhaps the most interesting relationship he has is with Lydia Montenegro. The two proprietors trade barbs, which might very well be mistaken for genuine hatred (the least of which is Ling calling Montenegro's boutique an "antique shop," to which she replies by calling his threads "atrocious" and needing new material). However, Ling's repartees and melodramatic responses show it is just ribbing. Ling is prone to flirting with the security detail at Tenpenny Tower, making a variety of more or less subtle passes. Despite his flamboyance and flirting, some residents remain oblivious of his homosexuality.

Anthony Ling's Personality: Flamboyant, snobbish, melodramatic, and sharp-witted. Anthony Ling has a flair for the dramatic and a tendency to use retail therapy as a solution to life's problems. He maintains a sophisticated facade but enjoys the playful banter with other residents of Tenpenny Tower. His homosexuality is an open secret among some residents, though others remain oblivious to his preferences.

Anthony Ling's Backstory: Born before the Great War in what was once Washington D.C., Anthony Ling survived the apocalypse through a combination of luck and resourcefulness. He established himself as a clothing merchant in the early years of the wasteland, trading scavenged pre-War apparel for other goods and services. His business acumen and ability to acquire rare, untouched clothing eventually earned him a place among the elite residents of Tenpenny Tower, where he opened his exclusive boutique. Despite the tower's snobbish atmosphere, Ling has carved out a niche for himself, becoming a trusted advisor on matters of fashion and appearance for many of the residents.
